name: 1945年後的藝術與文化（一）
description: This course will use English as a medium of instruction (EMI) and its aim is to equip students with sufficient English knowledge and skills to discuss art and the western civilization in appropriate English. The major content will extend from Greek mythology to contemporary thinking in art and cultures.
goals: To gain knowledge about art and western civilization.
To promote creative and critical thinking skills
To discuss issues about art and western cultures in appropriate English.
syllabus:
Goal:

For postgraduate students (MA, MFA, PhD) who is studying in art, art history or design, this course is underlining some key concepts and patterns of art and culture after 1945. Involvement is demanded. All participants have to share, present and discuss the individual idea and opinion with the others in this class. The aim of this course is also trying to clarify and improve the ability of postgraduate students in English.

Weekly Schedule:

1\. Introduction (Pilot test)

2\. Abstract Expressionism (I)

3\. Abstract Expressionism (II)

4\. Post-Painterly Abstraction (I)

5\. Post-Painterly Abstraction (II)

6\. Pop Culture after World War II (I)

7\. Pop Culture after World War II (II)

8\. Minimalism, Conceptual Art, Abstract Sculpture (I)

9. Minimalism, Conceptual Art, Abstract Sculpture (II)

10\. Mid-Term

11\. Postmodernism (I)

12\. Postmodernism (II)

13\. Neo-Expressionism (I)

14\. Neo-Expressionism (II)

15\. Key Artists and Tendencies (I)

16\. Key Artists and Tendencies (II)

17\. Final Examination (a)

18\. Final Examination (b)

methodologies.note: Illustrating the concepts and ideas of art and culture.
Group discussion for some individual issues or events.
Applying the film, vedio, or ppt to assist the lecture.
